camel.sink.path.exchangeName.name: camel.sink.path.exchangeName
camel.sink.path.exchangeName.description: The exchange name determines the exchange to which the produced messages will be sent to. In the case of consumers, the exchange name determines the exchange the queue will be bound to.

camel.sink.endpoint.addresses.name: camel.sink.endpoint.addresses
camel.sink.endpoint.addresses.description: If this option is set, camel-rabbitmq will try to create connection based on the setting of option addresses. The addresses value is a string which looks like server1:12345, server2:12345

camel.sink.endpoint.autoDelete.name: camel.sink.endpoint.autoDelete
camel.sink.endpoint.autoDelete.description: If it is true, the exchange will be deleted when it is no longer in use

camel.sink.endpoint.automaticRecoveryEna.name: camel.sink.endpoint.automaticRecoveryEnabled
camel.sink.endpoint.automaticRecoveryEna.description: Enables connection automatic recovery (uses connection implementation that performs automatic recovery when existing connection has failures)

camel.sink.endpoint.connectionFactory.name: camel.sink.endpoint.connectionFactory
camel.sink.endpoint.connectionFactory.description: To use a custom RabbitMQ connection factory. When this option is set, all connection options (connectionTimeout, requestedChannelMax...) set on URI are not used

camel.sink.endpoint.deadLetterExchange.name: camel.sink.endpoint.deadLetterExchange
camel.sink.endpoint.deadLetterExchange.description: The name of the dead letter exchange

camel.sink.endpoint.deadLetterExchangeTy.name: camel.sink.endpoint.deadLetterExchangeType
camel.sink.endpoint.deadLetterExchangeTy.description: The type of the dead letter exchange One of: [direct] [fanout] [headers] [topic]

camel.sink.endpoint.deadLetterQueue.name: camel.sink.endpoint.deadLetterQueue
camel.sink.endpoint.deadLetterQueue.description: The name of the dead letter queue

camel.sink.endpoint.deadLetterRoutingKey.name: camel.sink.endpoint.deadLetterRoutingKey
camel.sink.endpoint.deadLetterRoutingKey.description: The routing key for the dead letter exchange

camel.sink.endpoint.declare.name: camel.sink.endpoint.declare
camel.sink.endpoint.declare.description: If the option is true, camel declare the exchange and queue name and bind them together. If the option is false, camel won't declare the exchange and queue name on the server.

camel.sink.endpoint.durable.name: camel.sink.endpoint.durable
camel.sink.endpoint.durable.description: If we are declaring a durable exchange (the exchange will survive a server restart)

camel.sink.endpoint.exchangeType.name: camel.sink.endpoint.exchangeType
camel.sink.endpoint.exchangeType.description: The exchange type such as direct or topic. One of: [direct] [fanout] [headers] [topic]

camel.sink.endpoint.exclusive.name: camel.sink.endpoint.exclusive
camel.sink.endpoint.exclusive.description: Exclusive queues may only be accessed by the current connection, and are deleted when that connection closes.

camel.sink.endpoint.hostname.name: camel.sink.endpoint.hostname
camel.sink.endpoint.hostname.description: The hostname of the running rabbitmq instance or cluster.

camel.sink.endpoint.passive.name: camel.sink.endpoint.passive
camel.sink.endpoint.passive.description: Passive queues depend on the queue already to be available at RabbitMQ.

camel.sink.endpoint.portNumber.name: camel.sink.endpoint.portNumber
camel.sink.endpoint.portNumber.description: Port number for the host with the running rabbitmq instance or cluster. Default value is 5672.

camel.sink.endpoint.queue.name: camel.sink.endpoint.queue
camel.sink.endpoint.queue.description: The queue to receive messages from

camel.sink.endpoint.routingKey.name: camel.sink.endpoint.routingKey
camel.sink.endpoint.routingKey.description: The routing key to use when binding a consumer queue to the exchange. For producer routing keys, you set the header rabbitmq.ROUTING_KEY.

camel.sink.endpoint.skipDlqDeclare.name: camel.sink.endpoint.skipDlqDeclare
camel.sink.endpoint.skipDlqDeclare.description: If true the producer will not declare and bind a dead letter queue. This can be used if you have also DLQ rabbitmq consumer and you want to avoid argument clashing between Producer and Consumer. This option have no effect, if DLQ configured (deadLetterExchange option is not set).

camel.sink.endpoint.skipExchangeDeclare.name: camel.sink.endpoint.skipExchangeDeclare
camel.sink.endpoint.skipExchangeDeclare.description: This can be used if we need to declare the queue but not the exchange

camel.sink.endpoint.skipQueueBind.name: camel.sink.endpoint.skipQueueBind
camel.sink.endpoint.skipQueueBind.description: If true the queue will not be bound to the exchange after declaring it

camel.sink.endpoint.skipQueueDeclare.name: camel.sink.endpoint.skipQueueDeclare
camel.sink.endpoint.skipQueueDeclare.description: If true the producer will not declare and bind a queue. This can be used for directing messages via an existing routing key.

camel.sink.endpoint.additionalHeaders.name: camel.sink.endpoint.additionalHeaders
camel.sink.endpoint.additionalHeaders.description: Map of additional headers. These headers will be set only when the 'allowCustomHeaders' is set to true

camel.sink.endpoint.additionalProperties.name: camel.sink.endpoint.additionalProperties
camel.sink.endpoint.additionalProperties.description: Map of additional properties. These are standard RabbitMQ properties as defined in com.rabbitmq.client.AMQP.BasicProperties. The map keys should be from org.apache.camel.component.rabbitmq.RabbitMQConstants. Any other keys will be ignored.

camel.sink.endpoint.allowCustomHeaders.name: camel.sink.endpoint.allowCustomHeaders
camel.sink.endpoint.allowCustomHeaders.description: Allow pass custom values to header

camel.sink.endpoint.allowNullHeaders.name: camel.sink.endpoint.allowNullHeaders
camel.sink.endpoint.allowNullHeaders.description: Allow pass null values to header

camel.sink.endpoint.bridgeEndpoint.name: camel.sink.endpoint.bridgeEndpoint
camel.sink.endpoint.bridgeEndpoint.description: If the bridgeEndpoint is true, the producer will ignore the message header of rabbitmq.EXCHANGE_NAME and rabbitmq.ROUTING_KEY

camel.sink.endpoint.channelPoolMaxSize.name: camel.sink.endpoint.channelPoolMaxSize
camel.sink.endpoint.channelPoolMaxSize.description: Get maximum number of opened channel in pool

camel.sink.endpoint.channelPoolMaxWait.name: camel.sink.endpoint.channelPoolMaxWait
camel.sink.endpoint.channelPoolMaxWait.description: Set the maximum number of milliseconds to wait for a channel from the pool

camel.sink.endpoint.guaranteedDeliveries.name: camel.sink.endpoint.guaranteedDeliveries
camel.sink.endpoint.guaranteedDeliveries.description: When true, an exception will be thrown when the message cannot be delivered (basic.return) and the message is marked as mandatory. PublisherAcknowledgement will also be activated in this case. See also publisher acknowledgements - When will messages be confirmed.

camel.sink.endpoint.immediate.name: camel.sink.endpoint.immediate
camel.sink.endpoint.immediate.description: This flag tells the server how to react if the message cannot be routed to a queue consumer immediately. If this flag is set, the server will return an undeliverable message with a Return method. If this flag is zero, the server will queue the message, but with no guarantee that it will ever be consumed. If the header is present rabbitmq.IMMEDIATE it will override this option.

camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer
camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.sink.endpoint.mandatory.name: camel.sink.endpoint.mandatory
camel.sink.endpoint.mandatory.description: This flag tells the server how to react if the message cannot be routed to a queue. If this flag is set, the server will return an unroutable message with a Return method. If this flag is zero, the server silently drops the message. If the header is present rabbitmq.MANDATORY it will override this option.

camel.sink.endpoint.publisherAcknowledge.name: camel.sink.endpoint.publisherAcknowledgements
camel.sink.endpoint.publisherAcknowledge.description: When true, the message will be published with publisher acknowledgements turned on

camel.sink.endpoint.publisherAcknowledge.name: camel.sink.endpoint.publisherAcknowledgementsTimeout
camel.sink.endpoint.publisherAcknowledge.description: The amount of time in milliseconds to wait for a basic.ack response from RabbitMQ server

camel.sink.endpoint.args.name: camel.sink.endpoint.args
camel.sink.endpoint.args.description: Specify arguments for configuring the different RabbitMQ concepts, a different prefix is required for each: Exchange: arg.exchange. Queue: arg.queue. Binding: arg.binding. DLQ: arg.dlq.queue. DLQ binding: arg.dlq.binding. For example to declare a queue with message ttl argument: http://localhost:5672/exchange/queueargs=arg.queue.x-message-ttl=60000

camel.sink.endpoint.basicPropertyBinding.name: camel.sink.endpoint.basicPropertyBinding
camel.sink.endpoint.basicPropertyBinding.description: Whether the endpoint should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities

camel.sink.endpoint.clientProperties.name: camel.sink.endpoint.clientProperties
camel.sink.endpoint.clientProperties.description: Connection client properties (client info used in negotiating with the server)

camel.sink.endpoint.networkRecoveryInter.name: camel.sink.endpoint.networkRecoveryInterval
camel.sink.endpoint.networkRecoveryInter.description: Network recovery interval in milliseconds (interval used when recovering from network failure)

camel.sink.endpoint.requestedChannelMax.name: camel.sink.endpoint.requestedChannelMax
camel.sink.endpoint.requestedChannelMax.description: Connection requested channel max (max number of channels offered)

camel.sink.endpoint.requestedFrameMax.name: camel.sink.endpoint.requestedFrameMax
camel.sink.endpoint.requestedFrameMax.description: Connection requested frame max (max size of frame offered)

camel.sink.endpoint.requestedHeartbeat.name: camel.sink.endpoint.requestedHeartbeat
camel.sink.endpoint.requestedHeartbeat.description: Connection requested heartbeat (heart-beat in seconds offered)

camel.sink.endpoint.requestTimeout.name: camel.sink.endpoint.requestTimeout
camel.sink.endpoint.requestTimeout.description: Set timeout for waiting for a reply when using the InOut Exchange Pattern (in milliseconds)

camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous.name: camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous
camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used, or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

camel.sink.endpoint.topologyRecoveryEnab.name: camel.sink.endpoint.topologyRecoveryEnabled
camel.sink.endpoint.topologyRecoveryEnab.description: Enables connection topology recovery (should topology recovery be performed)

camel.sink.endpoint.transferException.name: camel.sink.endpoint.transferException
camel.sink.endpoint.transferException.description: When true and an inOut Exchange failed on the consumer side send the caused Exception back in the response

camel.sink.endpoint.allowMessageBodySeri.name: camel.sink.endpoint.allowMessageBodySerialization
camel.sink.endpoint.allowMessageBodySeri.description: Whether to allow Java serialization of the message body or not. If this value is true, the message body will be serialized on the producer side using Java serialization, if no type converter can handle the message body. On the consumer side, it will deserialize the message body if this value is true and the message contains a CamelSerialize header. Setting this value to true may introduce a security vulnerability as it allows an attacker to attempt to deserialize to a gadget object which could result in a RCE or other security vulnerability.

camel.sink.endpoint.sslProtocol.name: camel.sink.endpoint.sslProtocol
camel.sink.endpoint.sslProtocol.description: Enables SSL on connection, accepted value are true, TLS and 'SSLv3

camel.sink.endpoint.trustManager.name: camel.sink.endpoint.trustManager
camel.sink.endpoint.trustManager.description: Configure SSL trust manager, SSL should be enabled for this option to be effective

camel.sink.endpoint.username.name: camel.sink.endpoint.username
camel.sink.endpoint.username.description: Username in case of authenticated access

camel.component.rabbitmq.addresses.name: camel.component.rabbitmq.addresses
camel.component.rabbitmq.addresses.description: If this option is set, camel-rabbitmq will try to create connection based on the setting of option addresses. The addresses value is a string which looks like server1:12345, server2:12345

camel.component.rabbitmq.autoDelete.name: camel.component.rabbitmq.autoDelete
camel.component.rabbitmq.autoDelete.description: If it is true, the exchange will be deleted when it is no longer in use

camel.component.rabbitmq.connectionFacto.name: camel.component.rabbitmq.connectionFactory
camel.component.rabbitmq.connectionFacto.description: To use a custom RabbitMQ connection factory. When this option is set, all connection options (connectionTimeout, requestedChannelMax...) set on URI are not used

camel.component.rabbitmq.deadLetterExcha.name: camel.component.rabbitmq.deadLetterExchange
camel.component.rabbitmq.deadLetterExcha.description: The name of the dead letter exchange

camel.component.rabbitmq.deadLetterExcha.name: camel.component.rabbitmq.deadLetterExchangeType
camel.component.rabbitmq.deadLetterExcha.description: The type of the dead letter exchange One of: [direct] [fanout] [headers] [topic]

camel.component.rabbitmq.deadLetterQueue.name: camel.component.rabbitmq.deadLetterQueue
camel.component.rabbitmq.deadLetterQueue.description: The name of the dead letter queue

camel.component.rabbitmq.deadLetterRouti.name: camel.component.rabbitmq.deadLetterRoutingKey
camel.component.rabbitmq.deadLetterRouti.description: The routing key for the dead letter exchange

camel.component.rabbitmq.declare.name: camel.component.rabbitmq.declare
camel.component.rabbitmq.declare.description: If the option is true, camel declare the exchange and queue name and bind them together. If the option is false, camel won't declare the exchange and queue name on the server.

camel.component.rabbitmq.durable.name: camel.component.rabbitmq.durable
camel.component.rabbitmq.durable.description: If we are declaring a durable exchange (the exchange will survive a server restart)

camel.component.rabbitmq.exclusive.name: camel.component.rabbitmq.exclusive
camel.component.rabbitmq.exclusive.description: Exclusive queues may only be accessed by the current connection, and are deleted when that connection closes.

camel.component.rabbitmq.hostname.name: camel.component.rabbitmq.hostname
camel.component.rabbitmq.hostname.description: The hostname of the running RabbitMQ instance or cluster.

camel.component.rabbitmq.passive.name: camel.component.rabbitmq.passive
camel.component.rabbitmq.passive.description: Passive queues depend on the queue already to be available at RabbitMQ.

camel.component.rabbitmq.portNumber.name: camel.component.rabbitmq.portNumber
camel.component.rabbitmq.portNumber.description: Port number for the host with the running rabbitmq instance or cluster.

camel.component.rabbitmq.skipExchangeDec.name: camel.component.rabbitmq.skipExchangeDeclare
camel.component.rabbitmq.skipExchangeDec.description: This can be used if we need to declare the queue but not the exchange

camel.component.rabbitmq.skipQueueBind.name: camel.component.rabbitmq.skipQueueBind
camel.component.rabbitmq.skipQueueBind.description: If true the queue will not be bound to the exchange after declaring it

camel.component.rabbitmq.skipQueueDeclar.name: camel.component.rabbitmq.skipQueueDeclare
camel.component.rabbitmq.skipQueueDeclar.description: If true the producer will not declare and bind a queue. This can be used for directing messages via an existing routing key.

camel.component.rabbitmq.additionalHeade.name: camel.component.rabbitmq.additionalHeaders
camel.component.rabbitmq.additionalHeade.description: Map of additional headers. These headers will be set only when the 'allowCustomHeaders' is set to true

camel.component.rabbitmq.additionalPrope.name: camel.component.rabbitmq.additionalProperties
camel.component.rabbitmq.additionalPrope.description: Map of additional properties. These are standard RabbitMQ properties as defined in com.rabbitmq.client.AMQP.BasicProperties The map keys should be from org.apache.camel.component.rabbitmq.RabbitMQConstants. Any other keys will be ignored. When the message already contains these headers they will be given precedence over these properties.

camel.component.rabbitmq.allowNullHeader.name: camel.component.rabbitmq.allowNullHeaders
camel.component.rabbitmq.allowNullHeader.description: Allow pass null values to header

camel.component.rabbitmq.channelPoolMaxS.name: camel.component.rabbitmq.channelPoolMaxSize
camel.component.rabbitmq.channelPoolMaxS.description: Get maximum number of opened channel in pool

camel.component.rabbitmq.channelPoolMaxW.name: camel.component.rabbitmq.channelPoolMaxWait
camel.component.rabbitmq.channelPoolMaxW.description: Set the maximum number of milliseconds to wait for a channel from the pool

camel.component.rabbitmq.guaranteedDeliv.name: camel.component.rabbitmq.guaranteedDeliveries
camel.component.rabbitmq.guaranteedDeliv.description: When true, an exception will be thrown when the message cannot be delivered (basic.return) and the message is marked as mandatory. PublisherAcknowledgement will also be activated in this case. See also publisher acknowledgements - When will messages be confirmed.

camel.component.rabbitmq.immediate.name: camel.component.rabbitmq.immediate
camel.component.rabbitmq.immediate.description: This flag tells the server how to react if the message cannot be routed to a queue consumer immediately. If this flag is set, the server will return an undeliverable message with a Return method. If this flag is zero, the server will queue the message, but with no guarantee that it will ever be consumed. If the header is present rabbitmq.IMMEDIATE it will override this option.

camel.component.rabbitmq.lazyStartProduc.name: camel.component.rabbitmq.lazyStartProducer
camel.component.rabbitmq.lazyStartProduc.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.component.rabbitmq.mandatory.name: camel.component.rabbitmq.mandatory
camel.component.rabbitmq.mandatory.description: This flag tells the server how to react if the message cannot be routed to a queue. If this flag is set, the server will return an unroutable message with a Return method. If this flag is zero, the server silently drops the message. If the header is present rabbitmq.MANDATORY it will override this option.

camel.component.rabbitmq.publisherAcknow.name: camel.component.rabbitmq.publisherAcknowledgements
camel.component.rabbitmq.publisherAcknow.description: When true, the message will be published with publisher acknowledgements turned on

camel.component.rabbitmq.publisherAcknow.name: camel.component.rabbitmq.publisherAcknowledgementsTimeout
camel.component.rabbitmq.publisherAcknow.description: The amount of time in milliseconds to wait for a basic.ack response from RabbitMQ server

camel.component.rabbitmq.args.name: camel.component.rabbitmq.args
camel.component.rabbitmq.args.description: Specify arguments for configuring the different RabbitMQ concepts, a different prefix is required for each: Exchange: arg.exchange. Queue: arg.queue. Binding: arg.binding. DLQ: arg.dlq.queue. DLQ Binding: arg.dlq.binding. For example to declare a queue with message ttl argument: http://localhost:5672/exchange/queueargs=arg.queue.x-message-ttl=60000

camel.component.rabbitmq.autoDetectConne.name: camel.component.rabbitmq.autoDetectConnectionFactory
camel.component.rabbitmq.autoDetectConne.description: Whether to auto-detect looking up RabbitMQ connection factory from the registry. When enabled and a single instance of the connection factory is found then it will be used. An explicit connection factory can be configured on the component or endpoint level which takes precedence.

camel.component.rabbitmq.automaticRecove.name: camel.component.rabbitmq.automaticRecoveryEnabled
camel.component.rabbitmq.automaticRecove.description: Enables connection automatic recovery (uses connection implementation that performs automatic recovery when connection shutdown is not initiated by the application)

camel.component.rabbitmq.basicPropertyBi.name: camel.component.rabbitmq.basicPropertyBinding
camel.component.rabbitmq.basicPropertyBi.description: Whether the component should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities

camel.component.rabbitmq.clientPropertie.name: camel.component.rabbitmq.clientProperties
camel.component.rabbitmq.clientPropertie.description: Connection client properties (client info used in negotiating with the server)

camel.component.rabbitmq.networkRecovery.name: camel.component.rabbitmq.networkRecoveryInterval
camel.component.rabbitmq.networkRecovery.description: Network recovery interval in milliseconds (interval used when recovering from network failure)

camel.component.rabbitmq.requestedChanne.name: camel.component.rabbitmq.requestedChannelMax
camel.component.rabbitmq.requestedChanne.description: Connection requested channel max (max number of channels offered)

camel.component.rabbitmq.requestedFrameM.name: camel.component.rabbitmq.requestedFrameMax
camel.component.rabbitmq.requestedFrameM.description: Connection requested frame max (max size of frame offered)

camel.component.rabbitmq.requestedHeartb.name: camel.component.rabbitmq.requestedHeartbeat
camel.component.rabbitmq.requestedHeartb.description: Connection requested heartbeat (heart-beat in seconds offered)

camel.component.rabbitmq.requestTimeout.name: camel.component.rabbitmq.requestTimeout
camel.component.rabbitmq.requestTimeout.description: Set timeout for waiting for a reply when using the InOut Exchange Pattern (in milliseconds)

camel.component.rabbitmq.topologyRecover.name: camel.component.rabbitmq.topologyRecoveryEnabled
camel.component.rabbitmq.topologyRecover.description: Enables connection topology recovery (should topology recovery be performed)

camel.component.rabbitmq.transferExcepti.name: camel.component.rabbitmq.transferException
camel.component.rabbitmq.transferExcepti.description: When true and an inOut Exchange failed on the consumer side send the caused Exception back in the response

camel.component.rabbitmq.sslProtocol.name: camel.component.rabbitmq.sslProtocol
camel.component.rabbitmq.sslProtocol.description: Enables SSL on connection, accepted value are true, TLS and 'SSLv3

camel.component.rabbitmq.trustManager.name: camel.component.rabbitmq.trustManager
camel.component.rabbitmq.trustManager.description: Configure SSL trust manager, SSL should be enabled for this option to be effective

camel.component.rabbitmq.username.name: camel.component.rabbitmq.username
camel.component.rabbitmq.username.description: Username in case of authenticated access
